title: Several spells of light showers expected today
byline: Several spells of light showers will occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: EU and US agree trade deal, with 15% tariffs for European exports to America
byline: The United States and European Union have reached a trade deal framework, ending a months-long standoff between two of the world’s biggest economic partners.

title: President Dissanayake leaves for official visit to Maldives
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has left the island short while ago, to embark on a three-day official visit to Maldives from July 28 to 30, 2025.

title: Three killed and others injured in German train derailment
byline: At least three people have been killed and several others have been seriously injured after a passenger train derailed in south-west Germany, police say.

title: 18-year-old dies following assault in Matale
byline: An 18-year-old youth has died following an assault that escalated after an argument between two groups at a residence in the Palapathwela area of Matale.

title: One dead, over 5 injured as crane truck collides with multiple vehicles
byline: A fatal road accident occurred this morning (28 July) near the Cemetery Roundabout in Borella, resulting in the death of one person and injuries to more than five others, police said.

title: President Dissanayake to leave for Maldives today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to depart for Maldives today (July 28), on a state visit at the invitation of the Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu.

title: Israel begins daily pause in fighting in 3 Gaza areas to allow ‘minimal’ aid as hunger grows
byline: The Israeli military Sunday began limited pauses in fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day, part of measures including airdrops as concerns grow over surging hunger and as Israel faces criticism over its conduct in the 21-month war.

title: BBC uncovers lasting toxic legacy of cargo ship disaster off Sri Lanka
byline: Four years after a stricken cargo ship caused the largest plastic spill ever recorded, volunteers on Sri Lanka’s beaches are still sifting kilograms of tiny, toxic plastic pellets from the sand.

title: Suspect arrested over shooting incident at NPP councillor’s home
byline: A 33-year-old suspect has been arrested in Matara in connection with the shooting incident at the residence of Tharaka Nanayakkara, a National People’s Power (NPP) member of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, police said.

title: ‘Fantastic Four: First Steps’ scores Marvel’s first $100 million box office opening of 2025
byline: Marvel’s first family has finally found box office gold. “The Fantastic Four: First Steps,” the first film about the superheroes made under the guidance of Kevin Feige and the Walt Disney Co., earned $118 million in its first weekend in 4,125 North American theaters, according to studio estimates Sunday.

title: Thilini Priyamali arrested
byline: Businesswoman Thilini Priyamali, has been arrested by the Homagama police this morning (28), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: GovPay spot fine system launched in Western Province & on highways
byline: The spot fine payment system via GovPay has been implemented in the Western Province and on highways starting today (28 July).

title: Sri Lanka’s exports surge to USD 8.3 billion in first six months of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s export sector demonstrated remarkable resilience and steady progress during the first six months of 2025, with total exports reaching US$ 8,337.86 million, marking a robust 6.70 % growth compared to the same period in 2024., the Central Bank of Sri Lanka said.

title: Google failed to warn 10 million of Turkey earthquake
byline: Google has admitted its earthquake early warning system failed to accurately alert people during Turkey’s deadly quake of 2023.

title: Railway engine drivers threaten to strike on 30 and 31 July
byline: The Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union has announced that locomotive engine drivers will launch an island-wide 48-hour token strike starting from midnight tomorrow (29), citing unresolved issues.

title: Four Acting Ministers appointed during President’s visit to Maldives
byline: Acting Ministers have been appointed for four key ministries in light of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s state visit to the Maldives.

title: Musk says Tesla, Samsung Electronics sign $16.5 billion chip supply deal
byline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the U.S. automaker had signed a $16.5 billion deal to source chips from Samsung Electronics , a move expected to bolster the South Korean tech giant’s loss-making contract manufacturing business.

title: 4 killed in ‘mass shooting’ in Thai capital: police
byline: Four security guards were killed and one other person wounded in a mass shooting at a popular fresh food market in Thailand’s capital on Monday, police said.

title: Hearing of case against Yoshitha and his grandmother postponed to September
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Attorney General against Yoshitha Rajapaksa and his grandmother Daisy Forrest over the alleged unlawful acquisition of assets, be recalled on September 22, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: President Anura Kumara begins state visit to Maldives
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who left the island this morning (28), on a three-day state visit to the Maldives, landed at the Velana International Airport in Male, a short while ago.

title: President appoints new Chief Secretary for Uva Province
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed P.A.G. Fernando as the Chief Secretary of Uva Province, effective immediately, the President’s Media Division stated.

title: Bollywood film ‘Saiyaara’ becomes second biggest blockbuster of 2025
byline: The recently released Bollywood film Saiyaara has emerged as the second-highest-grossing film of 2025, raking in massive earnings both domestically and overseas within just nine days of its release.

title: Pre-trial conference fixed for ex-minister Mervyn Silva’s bribery case
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister Mervyn Silva, who is accused of illegally acquiring assets during his tenure as a minister, be taken up on September 24.

title: Former Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne arrested by CID
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire - Malaysia PM
byline: The leaders of Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an immediate and unconditional ceasefire to end their border clashes, Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Monday, following talks in Malaysia between the two Southeast Asian neighbours.

title: Russia’s Aeroflot cancels dozens of flights after information failure
byline: Russian airline Aeroflot cancelled dozens of flights on Monday after what it called a failure in its information systems.

title: Rs. 50 mln worth foreign cigarettes seized in largest-ever smuggling attempt at BIA
byline: A large consignment of foreign-manufactured cigarettes valued at Rs. 50 million was seized today (28) by officers of the Central Intelligence Directorate of Sri Lanka Customs while it was being transported through the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

title: Crane driver involved in fatal Borella accident tests positive for cannabis
byline: The crane driver involved in the fatal accident in Borella this morning (28), in which an individual died, was under the influence of cannabis, according to Police.

title: Arrest warrant issued against Namal Rajapaksa by Hambantota Court
byline: The Hambantota Magistrate’s Court has issued an arrest warrant for Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa for failing to appear in court for a trial, police stated.

title: ASPI surpasses 19,500 points for first time ever
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached a historic milestone today (15) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 19,500-points mark for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: Sri Lanka’s exports to US surpass USD 250 million in June as Trump tariffs loom
byline: Sri Lankan exports to the United States have increased in the month of June as the new 30% tariff rate announced by US President Donald Trump is set to take effect later this week.

title: Easter Attacks: Case against Pujith, Hemasiri to be taken up once again in September
byline: The case filed against former Secretary to the Ministry of Defence Hemasiri Fernando and former IGP Pujith Jayasundara before the Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar will be taken up once again on September 18.

title: Jeff Bezos sells USD 1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares
byline: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has sold 6.6 million Amazon shares, worth about USD 1.5 billion, just before the company’s second-quarter earnings report.

title: Former Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne remanded
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne who was arrested earlier today by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Two arrested over abduction and murder of youth in Kahawatta remanded
byline: Two individuals, who were arrested in connection with the abduction and murder of a youth in Kahawatta have been remanded until August 5, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Crane truck driver involved in fatal Borella accident tests positive for cannabis
byline: The crane driver involved in the fatal accident in Borella this morning (28), in which an individual died, was under the influence of cannabis, according to Police.

title: Owner of crane truck involved in fatal Borella accident arrested
byline: The owner of the crane truck involved in the fatal road accident that occurred this morning (28) in Borella has also been taken into custody, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka is a trusted destination for Maldivian investments – President AKD
byline: The President of Sri Lanka, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, currently on his first State Visit to the Maldives, has reiterated the long-standing and cordial relationship between the two island nations, marking a renewed chapter in their bilateral ties.

title: Thilini Priyamali granted bail
byline: Businesswoman Thilini Priyamali has been granted bail after being produced before the Homagama Magistrate’s Court today (28).

title: SC grants leave to proceed with seven FR petitions filed over Rambukkana shooting
byline: The Supreme Court today (28) granted leave to proceed with seven fundamental rights petitions filed in connection with the alleged violation of fundamental human rights during the Rambukkana protest that occurred during the time of the ‘Aragalaya’ in 2022.

title: Former Senior DIG Priyantha Jayakody arrested by CID
byline: Former Senior DIG Priyantha Jayakody has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Public urged not to fly kites near airports
byline: The general public has been requested to refrain from flying kites near airports in the country.

title: Broker arrested near DMT office in Narahenpita
byline: A broker who attempted to solicit a bribe near the head office of the Department of Motor Traffic in Narahenpita has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Fire breaks out at factory in Gampola
byline: A fire has broken out at a factory located on the Kandy-Nawalapitiya road in Gampola, police said.

title: Trump sets deadline of 10 or 12 days for Russia on war with Ukraine
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday increased pressure on Russia to end its war in Ukraine, saying he was setting a new deadline of 10 to 12 days for Moscow to make progress on doing so.
